attributes.action: Stop the BBC from Spending Licence Payers Money on Sporting Rights
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The BBC is supposed to be a public-broadcaster, meaning they should serve the public with high quality programming which we pay for with our licence fees. Recently the BBC has spent millions on sporting rights which as a non-sports fan I find wasteful. They should not be trying to compete with commercial channels for ratings but offering licence payers high quality programmes.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
